name: glazing production, triple, U<0.5 W/m2K | glazing, triple, U<0.5 W/m2K | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4582/documentation

This dataset describes the processes included in the production of 1.06m2 (corresponding to 1m2 visible area) triple glazing (3-IV) with a U-value below 0.5 W/m2K. It can be applied for triple glazing used in the building sector. 1 m2 visible glazing area has a final weight of 30 kg.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Included in this dataset are the materials and production processes of 1.06m2 (corresponding to 1m2 visible area) triple glazing (3-IV) with a U-value below 0.5 W/m2K including disposal of waste water and production wastes.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/231:Manufacture of glass and glass products/2310:Manufacture of glass and glass products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data estimated according to a European company.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The technology represents average European production.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Company documentation, calculations based on geometry
